title: Fragment, mid-20th century
medium:
Medium: silk
Technique: weft-faced plain weave patternd by weft bands, weft ikat, supplementary weft floats, supplementary warp floats and interlocked tapestry
provenance: origin supplied by donor - "I picked it up. The weaver who made it gave it to me in 1960 and Ii have an idea it was not done too long before that."
description: One end of a sari patterned by bands of weft ikat alternating with bands of plain weave some of which are patterned with tiny geometric shapes. A narrow border at each side and two plain ivory bands at one end with stepped triangles at the edge.

tombstone.epitaph:
Fragment, mid-20th century.Medium: silk
Technique: weft-faced plain weave patternd by weft bands, weft ikat, supplementary weft floats, supplementary warp floats and interlocked tapestry. 1970-5-1.
